message:
Hey WordPress gurus,

What's the latest and greatest WordPress backup / import-export plugin or tooling of the day in April 2016?

(Database, themes, plugins, extra files, and posts)

P.S.
I could obviously google for tools that do this. I'm flooded with results though. I was hoping for first hand experimenters recommendations instead of just more help googling.

Thanks a lot :)

data.message: I have checked plenty of them, and my favorite solution is to backup every part separately

+1 @ Loai's answer
It seems like you might get a good database backup plugin, but regarding the wp-content folder, you need to back it up on your own.
Cannot we work together to write sth specific to our needs?

If you are working with a small size WordPress website, then I recommend"
- Duplicator (https://wordpress.org/plugins/duplicator/). 
- Backup Buddy (https://ithemes.com/purchase/backupbuddy/) 

Backup Buddy is a paid plugin and slightly user friendly, Duplicator is just fine. The way these two plugins work is by backing up all your files and database into one zip file, in addition to a php "extractor" file.

If you are working with a larger website, having a 1GB+ zip backup of your website might not be that helpful when it's time to download/upload it. In that case, I would do a local backup and use an FTP for compare and sync, or git if you prefer, plus the database backup, manual or with a plugin. There is this powerful database backup tool https://deliciousbrains.com/wp-migrate-db-pro/, if you want a git type workflow, and want to make database migration just as easy to push and pull (expensive for my needs but seems popular online).

There are also web hosting services that offer decent WordPress backup solutions and integration with git.

you can just use Docker
https://www.docker.com/

I'm using a plugin called "BackWPup" for more than a year with no problems at all, i'm scheduling a weekly full backup to my Dropbox account and it works very smoothly.
https://wordpress.org/plugins/backwpup/
